sentences.english: She returned to the hearth, and frankly extended her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她又回到爐邊，坦率地伸出她的手。

sentences.english: People will respect you more if you own up to your problems.
sentences.chinese: 如果你坦率承任自己的問題，人們會更加尊重你。

sentences.english: Speak frankly, I pray you, be it for life or death.
sentences.chinese: 我請你坦率地講出來，不管我是該活還是該死。

sentences.english: I freely admit to being jealous of functions as first-class objects, for instance.
sentences.chinese: 我坦率承認，被嫉妒的職能一流的對象，例如。

sentences.english: Please tell me your opinion frankly.
"I'm sure you could use the money, " he said, bluntly.
sentences.chinese: “我敢肯定，你可以用這筆錢，”他說，坦率地指出。

sentences.english: His wife was straightforward woman and often asked some quite straightforward questions.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子是個坦率的人，常常會問寫很簡單的問題。

sentences.english: I like Norma because she's genuine person and never puts on side.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡諾馬，因爲她坦率真誠，從不擺架子。

sentences.english: Promote positive inter-departmental relations through candid communication and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 通過坦率的交流與合作促進部門內部的關係。

sentences.english: They hoped that disputes can be resolved through candid and sincere talks.
sentences.chinese: 雙方希望通過真誠與坦率的對話來處理意見分歧。

sentences.english: However, I can frankly tell you that differences still exist.
sentences.chinese: 但是我可以坦率地告訴你，分歧確實還存在。

sentences.english: Frank analysis, why can not get her mind to leave the old long scars.
sentences.chinese: 坦率分析，爲何沒法得到她，心裏長留下舊創疤。

sentences.english: She decided to level with him about her own sufferings.
sentences.chinese: 她決定坦率地和他講自己的苦處。

sentences.english: The Swedish experiment, to be frank, was a glorious failure.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地說，瑞典的實驗雖敗猶榮。

sentences.english: He felt disdain for worldly pleasures and was totally guileless , like a child. But he had a violent temper.
sentences.chinese: 他輕蔑世間的歡樂，像孩子一樣地坦率，但脾氣暴躁。
坦率地說，我認爲你在搞鬼。

definition: to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
